messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] What is a "cover school"?
messages.msgSnippet: ... Well I m sure other s replies will be better since we don t have them where I live, but in some states one of the homeschooling options is to operate under
messages.messageBody:
on 5/29/02 8:21 PM, shellyrae00 at shellyrae00@... wrote:

> Can someone tell me what a "cover school" is? Just curious ...

Well I'm sure other's replies will be better since we don't have them where
I live, but in some states one of the homeschooling options is to operate
under a "cover school". It's sort of like a private school that you don't
have to attend. The cover school abides by whatever regulations there are
for private schools (or cover schools) in that state and offers its services
to the homeschooling parents. Some offer (or require) oversight. Some offer
services. Some just offer their name for the state forms.

Joyce

messages.subject: What is a "cover school"?
messages.msgSnippet: Hello! Just wondering. I ve seen the term cover school mentioned in passing twice in the past week. I can t remember where, or I d ask the source. Can
messages.messageBody:
Hello!

Just wondering. I've seen the term "cover school" mentioned in
passing twice in the past week. I can't remember where, or I'd ask
the source.

Can someone tell me what a "cover school" is? Just curious ...

Thanks!

Shelly
